channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NC
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NC

item.title: Report X-2024071502
item.description:
Report X-2024071502

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-23T15:14:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-17
  • City: CONCORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: This package was brought to the QA cage for examination by a van line manager. The side of the package was wet and one side of the box was crushed. Upon inspection we noticed one of the caps on the Part B solution was loose which lead to the package being wet and contaminated. We made sure to place this box in a lined hazmat tote and moved it to the hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2024071299
item.description:
Report X-2024071299

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-22T18:15:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-15
  • City: DURHAM
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The damaged package was placed in a hazardous materials tote and taken to the hazardous materials staging area away from personnel and other packages. Upon inspection it was noted that the lid of the metal pail of adhesives was dented causing the lid to loosen and the contents to spill. There was no packaging in the box. The damaged package was placed in a hazardous materials drum awaiting disposition.

item.title: Report I-2024060048
item.description:
Report I-2024060048

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-19T18:15:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-16
  • City: WHITSETT
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: REPUBLIC ENVIRONMENTAL SYSTEMS (TRANSPORTATION GROUP), LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Republic Environmental Systems (Transportation Group) LLC (RESTG} had just accepted a load of manifested hazardous waste onto their truck. While the driver was finishing up paperwork one of the drums reacted causing the lid to pop off the drum, the material in the drum had spontaneously combusted. The ensuing fire destroyed all material in the cargo area of the truck. Material was initially manifested on manifest# 014614480FLE. After the fire drums were manifested on manifest 018982539FLE Do not yet have the numbers to complete the rest of question 32 ($ of damage/loss). Will provide in a supplemental follow-up report.

item.title: Report E-2024070340
item.description:
Report E-2024070340

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-18T15:13:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-12
  • City: CHARLOTTE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROADRUNNER TRANSPORTATION SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 12, 2024, at 0337 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Roadrunner personnel in Charlotte, North Carolina regarding the release of Callus Remover Eucamint. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 55 gallons of Callus Remover Eucamint (UN1814, 8, II) from (1) 55-gallon DF. The release was caused by a load shift and contained to pallets and a 6ft x 12ft area on the trailer floor. The load shift also damaged 2 more drums containing the same product, but without release. Contractors placed all 3 damaged drums into overpacks, then neutralized and cleaned the release using absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste was containerized in (3) 55-gallon DF’s and (3) 95-gallon DF’s and staged onsite by contractors for proper disposal.
